conclusion: The problem involves calculating the time it takes for light to travel from the center of the ball to the boundary of the ball, given the radius of the ball and the angle of incidence.
The properties of circles and the law of reflection will be used to solve the problem.
The given values are: Inner diameter of the ball = R, Outer diameter of the ball = 8R/3, Angle of incidence i = 30°, Speed of light c.
The radius of the ball is calculated as R = R/2.
The distance from the center of the ball to the boundary is determined as 8R/3 - R = 5R/3.
Using the law of reflection, the angle of incidence i = 30° means the angle of reflection is also 30°.
The time for light to travel from the center to the boundary is calculated as t = d/c = (5R/3)/c.
Substituting the given values, R = 1 and c = 3 × 10^8, into the formula t = 5R/3c.
The propagation time is calculated as t = 5 × 10^8.
The time is converted to seconds: t = 5 × 10^8 × 1/3600 ≈ 1.428 × 10^5 seconds.
The time is converted to minutes: 1.428 × 10^5 seconds = 1428 minutes.
The time is converted to hours: 1428 minutes = 24.433 hours.
The time is rounded to two decimal places: 24.433 hours = 24.43 hours.
The final answer is that the propagation time of monochromatic light in the water polo is approximately 24.43 hours.
